title: Blackbeard's Secret Purpose in Impel Down
theoryText: Fans theorized that Blackbeard's infiltration of Impel Down was not just coincidental but part of a larger strategic plan. Questions raised include whether there's a secret stash of Devil Fruits somewhere in the prison, or if there's a clue to Raftel's location hidden in a vault. The theory suggests Blackbeard risked his Warlord position for something far more valuable than just causing chaos.
author: Various Tumblr and Reddit users
evidence: Crocodile questions why Blackbeard would risk his Warlord status
Blackbeard hints at having a larger plan when questioned
His crew infiltrates deeper into the prison rather than escaping

title: Luffy vs Blackbeard as the Final Fight
theoryText: Fans theorize that the encounter between Luffy and Blackbeard at Impel Down foreshadows their eventual final battle for the title of Pirate King. The theory examines how Luffy 'just happens to cross Blackbeard's path' throughout the series and analyzes why Blackbeard will be Luffy's greatest opponent, drawing parallels to their contrasting philosophies about dreams and the nature of piracy.
author: swans-anime-ramblings
evidence: Blackbeard confirms One Piece exists, showing they share the same goal
Their Devil Fruits have a unique interaction (darkness nullifies rubber)
Both were mentioned in connection to the 'D' clan
Their philosophies about dreams contrasted in their first meeting
Blackbeard directly caused Ace's capture, creating personal enmity

title: Impel Down Arc Shows Luffy's Moral Ambiguity
theoryText: Some fans argue that the Impel Down arc, particularly episodes around 447, proves Luffy was never the classic shonen hero we thought he was. The theory points out that Luffy freed some of the world's worst criminals and indirectly helped Blackbeard complete his crew by causing chaos in the prison. This demonstrates Luffy's willingness to work with villains and create collateral damage when pursuing his personal goals.
author: Various fan discussion participants
evidence: Luffy allies with former enemies like Crocodile and Buggy
He breaks out dangerous Level 6 prisoners
His actions indirectly help Blackbeard recruit his crew
He prioritizes personal relationships over broader moral considerations
